ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was
What is your overall assessment of this course
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I think I improved at French during this class and learned a lot from the course materials
I developed stronger skills in listening, speaking, reading, and writing French.
My French writing, grammar, and speaking abilities have improved.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I really like the readings and movies from this course. I think it could be improved by more speaking practice

Strengths: M. Ngame is a great professor, and I enjoyed the stories we read!
Weaknesses: I wish that we spent more time on Un Sac de Billes, and I wish that we went over our compositions in class so we could have more directed guidance on writing.

Strengths: great class discussions and you learn a lot of French
Weakness: very high workload and fast paced. The last week especially had too much reading.

Online tests are really flawed, and canvas quizzes leave no room for interpretation. Also we don't actually get a result of our tests back, so we don't know what things we actually need to improve on although the instructor's quizzes are very useful in preparing for the test.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes -- do your language over the summer! It will save you so much time during the year.
Yes, especially if you want to improve your French and become a better speaker
It's pretty intensive and good for picking up the language, but it's definitely a lot of work.
